btClient

Class Peer

  • java.lang.Object
    • btClient.Peer

  • public class Peer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is tasked with managing the connection with a peer and sending receiving messages between that peer. Handling of messages should take place elsewhere
    Author:
    Cody

      • has_piece

        public boolean has_piece(int pieceIndex)
        Checks if a this peer has the piece indicated by the piece index
        Parameters:
        pieceIndex - the zero based index of the piece to be checked
        Returns:
        True if this peer has the indicated piece, False if peer does not have piece or if has not yet been set

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()

      • establishConnection

        public boolean establishConnection(java.nio.ByteBuffer info_hash,
                          java.nio.ByteBuffer clientID)
                            throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        Establishes a connection with the peer by creating a socket to the peer's IP address and port number then creates a handshake message from the given info_hash and clientID
        Parameters:
        info_hash - info_hash of from the torrent file (must match that of the peer's)
        clientID - psuedorandom peer_ID identifying the client (not this peer)
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException
        java.io.IOException

      • reconnect

        public void reconnect()

      • isSameHash

        public boolean isSameHash(byte[] info_hash,
                 byte[] response_info_hash)
        Just verifies that the info hash are the same. If not, we should drop the connection
        Returns:
        boolean True if remote and local peer have the same info_hash, otherwise false

      • ConvertBitfieldToArray

        public static boolean[] ConvertBitfieldToArray(byte[] bitfield,
                               int numPieces)
        Converts the bytes of a bitfield to a boolean array. If we get a 1 the peer has the piece.
        Parameters:
        bitfield - bitfield message received from the peer
        numPieces - number of pieces to the downloading file
        Returns:
        boolean array of boolean values representing the peers possesion of the peice corresponding to the array's index

      • incrementPeerCounters

        public void incrementPeerCounters(java.util.ArrayList<Piece> pieces)
        Increments the peerCount for each Piece in the list of pieces by calling Piece.incrementPeerCount()
        Parameters:
        pieces - An array list of Piece objects

      • sendRequest

        public void sendRequest(int index,
               int block_offset,
               int block_length)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a request message to the peer
        Parameters:
        index - zero based index of the piece being requested
        block_offset - offset of block being requested
        block_length - number of bytes in a typical block in the piece
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • sendPiece

        public void sendPiece(Piece piece,
             int offset,
             int payload_size)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a piece message to the peer
        Parameters:
        piece - the Piece being sent to the peer
        offset - the block offset to send to the peer
        size - the size of the block to send to the peer
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • sendBitfield

        public void sendBitfield(boolean[] has_piece)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Converts a given boolean array into a bitfield and sends the bitfield to the connected peer
        Parameters:
        has_piece - boolean array to send as a bitfield
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getMessage

        public byte[] getMessage()
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.lang.InterruptedException
        Reads a message form the peer
        Returns:
        null if no bytes were read or if there were an incorrect number of byte representing the length_prefix. Otherwise returns the message (without its length prefix, message_id is in index = 0)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.InterruptedException
